commentary.a:
lon tenpo pini tawa pu en tenpo kama tawa pu la jan mute li toki ni: nimi "a" en nimi "kin" li sama ala.
taso: pu li toki ni: nimi "a" en nimi "kin" li sama li nimi "a".
commentary.akesi: akesi used to mean "non-cute animal," and is defined this way in pu, but this definition has fallen out of use and was later removed in the pu annotations published with ku.
commentary.alasa: In some communities, the usage of "alasa" as a preverb meaning "try to" is equally or even more common than "lukin". In pu, only "lukin"/"oko" has this meaning.
commentary.ale:
"ali" is an alternative to "ale", coined in a poll in 2002 in order to avoid confusion with "ala". However, the usage of "ale" over "ali" remains more common.
The majority of speakers report not understanding the "abundant, bountiful, plentiful" meaning, at least out of context.
"20, 120" were non-pu meanings previously in use in the community alongside 100; they are virtually unheard of nowadays.
commentary.ali: "ali" is an alternative to "ale", coined in a poll in 2002 in order to avoid confusion with "ala". However, the usage of "ale" over "ali" has been more common since at least the release of pu. Generally not considered a word in its own right.
commentary.anpa:
lon tenpo pini tawa pu en tenpo kama tawa pu la jan mute li toki ni: nimi "anpa" li sama e nimi "ma anpa".
taso: pu li toki ni: nimi "noka" li sama e nimi "ma anpa".
commentary.anu: The usage of "anu" as a content word meaning "choose" remains controversial.
commentary.apeja: According to jan Sonja, "apeja" never appeared in any pre-pu toki pona dictionary made by her and never promoted by her, instead it may have been "just an experimental idea in a forum post".
commentary.en: There are various analyses of the syntactic role of "en". Originally intended to be used as "and", it was changed (via poll in 2002) to just be used with "head nouns". One of the more recent analyses (including 2021's April Fools) treats "en" as a subject marker.
commentary.esun: jan Sonja li toki e ni: jan li tawa e jan Sonja lon tomo ona tawa. jan li toki e toki pi kulupu Akan. kulupu ni li lon ma Apika pi pini suno. ona li toki e nimi "esun" tawa jan Sonja.
commentary.jan: There are two sides to the concept, "sentient entity" and "homo sapiens", which matters for whether to use the word in edge cases (i.e. aliens, humans turned into werewolves, etc). Which sense is more central to the word remains controversial.
commentary.jelo: Some extend "jelo" to include lime green, but this usage is uncommon.
commentary.jonke: nimi ni li tan kuplupu olin pi musi Untite Kuse Kame.
commentary.kamalawala: The word is from a story called "jan pi Kamalawala". A character's name is described as "nimi Jan pi Kama e Lawa Ala", and a shortened version given as "nimi Kamalawala". jan Kipo is responsible for it becoming a word instead of just a name.
commentary.kepeken: Whether "kepeken" should be used with or without "e" in a predicative position (meaning "to use") remains controversial.
commentary.kijetesantakalu: nimi ni li nimi musi tan tenpo suno musi pi tenpo sike mute ale luka tu tu.
commentary.kiki: The word is loaned from the 2001 Vilanyur S Ramachandran & Edward Hubbard version of Wolfgang KÃ¶hler's 1912 psycholinguistic experiment. The experiment studied sound symbolism on the words "bouba" and "kiki".
commentary.kili: In post-ku 2021, metaphorical definitions for kili have been suggested, including but not limited to "offspring" and "product", and are moderately popular. It is not yet clear whether this will remain in use long-term.
commentary.kin:
In common usage (both before and after pu), "a" and "kin" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms.
Underwent significant changes in usage in 2002, alongside "en" and (now obsolete) "kan".
commentary.kiwen: lon tenpo sike mute ale tu la nimi "wawa ma" li kama nimi ni tan lipu pi wile kulupu.
commentary.ko: The "clinging form" definition was elaborated to mean "a shape or mass that sticks or clings; a clot, a thick or viscous lump, a clump that can be reshaped".
commentary.kokosila: toki Epelanto la, nimi "krokodili" li jo e kon sama nimi 'kokosila'. jan mute li sona e ona lon toki Epelanto.
commentary.konwe:
Conway refers to John Horton Conway, creator of the cellular automaton Game of Life.
konwe's intended meaning extends beyond just "living" and "life." It can be used to describe rocks or rivers or other nonliving things
commentary.ku: sina wile esun e lipu ni la o tawa lipu kon pi toki pona.
commentary.kule: in addition to its pu-definitions, kule is sometimes used to talk about more general kinds of categories, like type, kind, flavour, gender, etc.
commentary.lukin: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances. The usage of "alasa" as a preverb meaning "try to" is more common than "lukin". In pu, only "lukin" has this meaning. A very common beginner mistake is treating "lukin" as if it means "appearance", due to the mistakenly equating the "visual" meaning as in "pona lukin (visually good)" to mean "looks good".
commentary.misikeke: The word was used privately by jan Sonja up until November 2019, when she mentioned it in the ma pona pi toki pona discord server as a word she was experimenting with. It is believed the word was originally coined in 2007-2009 alongside pan, esun, apeja, monsuta, and pu, but this cannot be proven.
commentary.namako: In common usage (both before and after pu), "sin" and "namako" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "namako" at all, preferring "sin" in all circumstances.
commentary.nimisin: Mostly used in conversations in English. Likely was popularised by the :nimisin: emote in ma pona, which was originally used to notify Atawan (maintainer of "nimi ale") about newly coined words. In common speech, the meaning got extended to include most or all non-pu words, regardless if they were coined recently or not.
commentary.noka:
jan mute li kepeken nimi noka sama nimi ijo kepeken noka.
tawa jan ni la nimi noka li nimi pakala kepeken noka en nimi tawa noka lon ijo en nimi pilin kepeken noka en nimi ante sama.
commentary.oko: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances, though some speakers do the opposite and use "oko" exclusively instead.
commentary.olin: toki Inli li kepeken nimi "love" sama nimi pilin pona mute a. taso toki pona li ante la nimi olin li sama pilin mute lon tenpo mute li sama ala pona anu ike.
commentary.omekapo: Coined by jan Maliku in reference to the message "o moku e kala pona", which jan Sonja wrote on their copy of Toki Pona: The Language of Good during a Texas meetup.
commentary.ona: This word was coined in a poll in 2002. It replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar-sounding to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi" and "i".
commentary.open: Some proficient speakers use open as a preverb that means "start to," that goes along with the complimentary pini preverb "to stop"
commentary.penpo: Coined in reference to ma pona pi toki pona's "tenpo pi toki pona taso" event, shortening it to "tenpo penpo".
commentary.pi: The usage of "pi" to mean "of" (marking a possessor) is heavily discouraged nowadays, preferring it to only be used for regrouping within phrases.
commentary.pini: Some proficient speakers use pini as a preverb that means "to stop," that goes along with the complimentary open preverb "start to"
commentary.poki: poki is sometimes used as "category" or to express types of things. One example is roles or groups, in discord chat contexts
commentary.pu: sina wile esun e lipu ni la o tawa lipu kon pi toki pona.
commentary.san:
More popular than the synonymous (and older) tuli.
san was also part of a set of 10 digit words created by jan Lenoka: lenke, jatu, ini, san, se, nun, loku, take, patu, kajo (0 through 9). All of these coinages except for san lack notability to be included in the main dictionary. They can be found in the sandbox.
commentary.seli: In pu, definitions of seli are described as adjectives. ku's pu corrections clarify that these refer to nouns instead.
commentary.sin: In common usage (both before and after pu), "sin" and "namako" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "namako" at all, preferring "sin" in all circumstances.
commentary.su: This word was originally coined in ku as a reserved word for jan Sonja's future use. It was redefined upon the release of the first su book, making its status as a ku word debatable.
commentary.sutopatikuna: Coined by Alexandre Baudry in 2009 in response to jan Sonja coining "kijetesantakalu" as part of 2009's April Fools.
commentary.taso: Some proficient speakers use taso as a connector between sentences (X taso Y), similar to "X, but Y," as though taso behaved like la grammatically.
commentary.te: May be paired with "to", or used on its own. It is unclear how accepted either approach is among te / to users.
commentary.to: May be paired with "te", or used on its own. It is unclear how accepted either approach is among te / to users.
commentary.tonsi:
* - Broader in meaning, somewhat less commonly accepted.
Widely regarded in the community to be a crucial addition to toki pona. Occasionally referred to as an "honorary pu word" to highlight its status, or equated to a pu word outright.
commentary.unpa: Also defined as "have marital relations with" in pu; removed due to potential confusion.
commentary.usawi: Originally, usawi also included "technology so complex it's impossible to tell apart from magic" in its meaning, but this meaning has been deprecated by the creator.
commentary.uta: The dot in the "uta" sitelen pona is to distinguish luka-uta from moku.
commentary.wa: Sometimes analyzed as a variety of "a".
commentary.wasoweli: First used as the name for a species in a mod for Caves of Qud created by akesi kon Nalasuni. Later appeared in ku as exclusively part of a translation for "penguin".
commentary.wuwojiti: May be seen not as a word in toki pona, but as a kind of memorisation tool in English to refer to the "banned" syllables. Occasionally extended to wuwojitinmanna to include the illegal consecutive nasal consonants.
commentary.yupekosi: Coined as a random keystroke. It is presumed jan Sonja used "y" by mistake, but then made it part of the joke by adding "nobody knows how to pronounce the y".

definitions.a: nimi a li mu toki li pana e pilin. ona li lon kama nimi la ona li wawa e pilin nimi.
definitions.akesi: akesi li ken pilin. ken suli la ona li lete tawa luka sina. sijelo ona li jo e noka la, ken suli la noka tu tu li lon. noka ala la, selo ona li linja. mute a la selo ona li telo lili.
definitions.ala: ijo li loje ala la loje li weka tan ona. ona li ken laso li ken jelo li ken pimeja, taso loje li weka tan ken.
definitions.alasa: hunt, forage, search, attempt; (preverb) try to
definitions.ale: mi kepeken nimi "ale" la mi poki e ijo. mi poki e ijo seme? ijo ala a la nimi "ale" li poki ala e ona. ijo li lon la nimi "ale" li toki e ona. (ona li nanpa la) ona li toki e nanpa mute mute mute mute mute.
definitions.ali: kon pi nimi ni li sama "ale". taso kalama li ante lili. kalama pini li "i" li "e" ala.
definitions.anpa: ijo wan li lon anpa pi ijo ante la, ijo nanpa tu li lon sewi. ante la, ijo wan li anpa tawa ijo ante la ijo nanpa tu li ken lawa e ijo nanpa wan li ken suli tawa ijo nanpa wan.
definitions.ante: sama ala. sina ni la ijo li kama sama ala. ijo sama ala. kule sama ala.
definitions.anu: (particle) [separates multiple possibilities, replacing another particle], or
definitions.apeja: mi mute li weka e ona tan kulupu pi mi mute la, ona li pilin ike mute. ona li pilin apeja tan ni: mi mute li apeja e ona.
definitions.awen: ijo li ante ala la, ona li awen. sina awen pali la, sina pali lon tenpo pini li pali lon tenpo lon. mi awen e tomo la, tomo li ante ala lon tenpo tan mi.
definitions.e: (particle) [marks the start of a direct object]
definitions.esun: sina pana e ijo tawa mi la mi pana e ijo tawa sina. mi en sina li esun. jan mute li esun lon ma wan la ma ni li esun kin.
definitions.ijo: mi ijo. sina ijo. ale li ken ijo. sina ken toki e ona la ona li ijo.
definitions.ike: ijo ike li weka e pona e pilin pona. ona li ken pakala, li ken jaki.
definitions.ilo: jan li ken pali kepeken ilo; jan li kepeken ilo tawa ni: ilo ala la pali li wile e wawa mute
definitions.insa: insa ijo li lon selo ijo. ijo pi insa poki li lon poki.
definitions.isipin: sina toki insa la, sina isipin. sitelen pi lawa sina li isipin.
definitions.jaki: ijo jaki li ike tawa pilin, li ken ike tawa lukin tawa uta tawa nena tawa luka tawa kute. mi moku e ijo jaki la, ijo ni li ike a tawa uta mi. mi pilin e kon jaki la, kon li ike pilin tawa nena mi.
definitions.jami: moku li pona tawa sina la, ona li jami.
definitions.jan: ijo ni li wile, li ken tawa. ijo ni li lon, li ken pilin, li ken toki. ijo ni li ken kama sona e ijo suli, li ken ante e ma. ona li pali. mama toki li ijo ni.
definitions.jelo: jelo li kule. suno pi suno sewi suli li jelo lili.
definitions.jo: sina jo e ijo la ijo ni li lon luka sina anu ijo ni li sina anu ijo ni li insa sina.
definitions.jonke: kalama pi waso telo suli. waso telo suli.
definitions.kala: kala li pilin li lon telo li ken tawa lon telo.
definitions.kalama: kalama li tawa lon kon. ijo mute li ken pilin e kalama kepeken kute.
definitions.kama: tenpo wan la, ijo li lon ala. tenpo li tawa la, ijo li lon. tenpo pi ante ni li kama. ijo li kama ante la, ona li ante ala lon tenpo pini li ante lon tenpo ni. ante ni li kama. ijo li kama la, ona li kama lon li lon ala lon tenpo pini.
definitions.kamalawala: tenpo kama pi lawa ala li tenpo kamalawala.
definitions.kapesi: kapesi li kule. kule ni li wawa ala. ma mute li kapesi. kiwen mute li kapesi.
definitions.kasi: kasi li soweli pi tawa ala; ona li moku e suno kepeken lipu laso li moku e ijo ma kepeken noka ona
definitions.ken: can, may, ability, permission; possibility, maybe; allow, enable; (preverb) to be able to
definitions.kepeken: nimi ni li toki e nasin pali. mi pali kepeken ilo la, ilo ni li ken e pali mi li lon nasin pali.
definitions.kijetesantakalu: raccoon, kinkajou; any procyonid; any musteloid
definitions.kiki: ijo li kiki la, ona li ken pakala e selo jan. poka pi ijo kiki li sike ala. poka ona li jo e nena pakala mute.
definitions.kili: kasi li pana e kili. kili mute li moku pona li ken suwi li ken sike.
definitions.kin: (particle) [after phrase or at sentence start] too, also, as well, additionally
definitions.kipisi: split, cut, slice; piece, part; sharp, pointy
definitions.kiwen: ijo li kiwen la selo ona en sijelo ona li wile ala ante. ijo li ken ante e selo kiwen kepeken wawa suli taso a.
definitions.ko: semi-solid, e.g. paste, powder, goo, sand, soil, clay; squishy, moldable; sticky
definitions.kokosila: sina toki e toki ante lon ma pi toki pona taso la, sina kokosila.
definitions.kon: kon li kiwen ala li telo ala. sama ala kiwen la selo ona li awen ala li kama ante mute. sama ala ijo mute la kon li wile ala lon anpa. kon mute la mi ken ala lukin e ona.
definitions.konwe: ijo li ken tawa kepeken ona sama la ona li konwe. jan en soweli li konwe.
definitions.ku: lipu li lon li tan jan Sonja. ni li lipu nanpa tu tan jan Sonja. sina luka anu lukin anu kepeken lipu ni la sina ku.
definitions.kule: color, pigment; category, genre, flavor; colorful, diverse
definitions.kulijo: (interjection) [casually express appreciation or acknowledgement]; cool, fine, okay
definitions.kulupu: ijo mute li lon li sama lon nasin wan la ona li ken kulupu ijo. ken wan la ijo li pali lon kulupu la ijo kulupu li pali tawa wile wan. ken ante la ijo li kulupu tan ni: ona li lon ma sama.
definitions.kute: ijo li kute e kalama la ona li pilin e kalama. kute li sama lukin li pilin e kalama e suno ala.
definitions.la: (particle) [mark the previous statement as context to the following statement]
definitions.lanpan: mi lanpan e ijo la mi weka e ona tan ijo ante li awen jo e ona lon ala wile pi ijo ante.
definitions.lape: ijo li pali li pini e pali li awen lon tenpo la ona li lape. pini lape la ijo li awen pali.
definitions.laso: laso li kule. kasi mute li laso. sewi li laso.
definitions.lawa: head, mind, brain; control, lead, guide; government, leader; rule, law
definitions.leko: square, cube, block, blocky object e.g. bricks, stairs
definitions.len: len li awen e seli lon selo. len li weka e ken lukin.
definitions.lete: seli ala. ijo li lete la ona li awen li kama kiwen.
definitions.li: (particle) [marks the start of an indicative verb (statement)]
definitions.lili: small, short, young; few; piece, part
definitions.linja: long, flexible thing, e.g. rope, yarn, hair, fur, line, strand
definitions.linluwi: bonded things which are stronger through their bonds e.g. network, internet, connection; weave, braid, interlace
definitions.lipu: lipu li sama supa taso ona li ken kama sike sama linja. sona li ken lon lipu.
definitions.loje: loje li kule. selo jan li pakala la ona li pana e telo pi kule ni.
definitions.lon: present, existing, real, true; (preposition) located at, in, during, in the context of
definitions.luka: palisa sijelo. ona li ken jo e ijo.
definitions.lukin: ijo ni li lon sijelo. selo la ona li ken sike li ken ante. ijo poka li pana e suno la ijo ni li moku e suno la mi sona e lon ijo tan suno ni. mi lukin e ijo.
definitions.lupa: lupa li lon supa la supa li kama anpa anu insa.
definitions.ma: earth, land, soil; country, territory, world; outdoors
definitions.majuna: tenpo mute la, sina li lon. ni la, sina jan majuna.
definitions.mama: ijo li mama la ijo ante li tan ona. jan li mama e ijo la ona li pali li awen e ijo pana.
definitions.mani: sina ken esun kepeken ijo la ijo ni li mani
definitions.melome: meli li olin e meli la ona li melome.
definitions.meso: moku mi li seli ala li lete ala. ona li meso tawa mi. lipu sina li pona ala li ike ala. ona li meso.
definitions.mi: (nimi jan) jan toki en jan poka toki
definitions.mijomi: mije li olin e mije la ona li mijomi.
definitions.misa: misa li soweli lili. ona li lon poka pi tomo jan. ona li ike tawa jan mute.
definitions.misikeke: misikeke li pona tawa sijelo tawa lawa.
definitions.moku: ijo li moku e ijo ante la ijo nanpa tu li tawa insa pi ijo nanpa wan li kama lon sijelo ona. ken suli la ijo nanpa wan li moku kepeken uta.
definitions.moli: pali ijo li pini ale la ona li moli. ijo li moli la, ona o ken ala open sin lon tenpo kama.
definitions.monsi: monsi ijo li poka ijo. ijo li tawa la ona li tawa nasin pi monsi ona ala
definitions.monsuta: ijo ike li ken lon li ken utala e mi li ken pakala e mi la sijelo li awen e mi kepeken pilin monsuta. ijo pi ike ken kin li monsuta.
definitions.mu: soweli li kalama la ona li mu
definitions.mulapisu: mulapisu li pan sike loje tan ma Italija.
definitions.mun: sewi li pimeja la ijo li ken lukin e suno lili mute lon sewi. suno ale ni li mun. mun li tawa lon sewi pimeja. ken suli la ona li sike.
definitions.musi: fun, game, entertainment, art, play, amusing, interesting, comical, silly
definitions.mute: kulupu ijo li lon la ijo mute li lon kulupu. mute ijo li suli la kulupu ijo kin li suli. mute ijo li lili la kulupu kin li lili.
definitions.n: (interjection) hm, uh, mm, er, umm, [indicate thinking or pause]
definitions.namako: ijo li lon. mi nasa e ijo kepeken ijo sin pona. mi namako e ijo.
definitions.nasa: ijo nasa li sama ala ijo poka. ante la jan li moku e telo nasa la ona li ken kama toki nasa li ken kama pali nasa.
definitions.nasin: mi tawa lon nasin la mi kama lon ma ante. mi pali lon nasin la nasin li ni: mi pali seme kepeken seme tawa wile seme
definitions.nena: nena li lon supa la supa li kama sewi anu insa ala.
definitions.ni: ijo li lon ma poka anu ma weka la mi ken toki e ona kepeken nimi ni
definitions.nimi: toki ale li kepeken nimi. nimi li ken lon sitelen lon kalama lon luka.
definitions.nimisin: nimi pi pu ala; nimi sin; nimi musi
definitions.nja: ona li sama mu pi soweli suwi lili. jan mute la, soweli suwi ni li lon tomo ona li pona nanpa wan.
definitions.noka: palisa sijelo. mi tawa e sijelo kepeken ona
definitions.o: (particle) [marks the end of a vocative (who is being spoken to)], [marks the start of an imperative (command, wish, instruction)], should
definitions.ojuta: nimi "ojuta" la, jan toki li wile taso e alasa ni tan jan kute: "ojuta li seme". la jan toki li ken toki e ni: "o uta e sike mi". ni li sama musi "ligma" pi toki Inli.
definitions.oke: sina pilin pona la, sina pilin oke. ijo li pona tawa sina la, o toki e ni: "ke!" sina wile e ijo? sina wile la, o toki e ni: "ke."
definitions.oko: ijo ni li lon sijelo. selo la ona li ken sike li ken ante. ijo poka li pana e suno la ijo ni li moku e suno la mi sona e lon ijo tan suno ni. mi lukin e ijo.
definitions.olin: mi olin e ijo la mi wile wawa e ni: ona o awen o suwi o pakala ala
definitions.omekapo: mi tawa, o tawa pona, mi tu li ken kama poka lon tenpo kama. jan li weka tan jan ante la jan li ken toki e "omekapo". ona li tan "o moku e kala pona."
definitions.ona: ijo li toki e nimi "ona" la ona li toki sin e ijo tan sona poka. ijo li ken tan ma poka li ken tan toki pini li ken tan nasin sona ante.
definitions.open: mi open e ilo la ona li kama pali. mi open e poki la mi kama ken lukin e insa. mi open e pali la mi kama pali.
definitions.owe: totalitarian, Orwellian; of or relating to Big Brother from the book Ninety Eighty-Four
definitions.pakala: mi utala e nasin ijo la ona li kama pakala. pakala li weka ala la ona li ken ala kama pali sin.
definitions.pake: sina pini moku lon tenpo lili. sina pake moku, taso sina moku lon tenpo ni.
definitions.pakola: [nasin sitelen pi nimi pakala li pakala]
definitions.pali: ijo li pali la ona li kepeken wawa ona li lon e ijo sin.
definitions.palisa: palisa li suli lon poka wan taso li lili lon poka ante. palisa li kiwen li ken ala kama linja.
definitions.pan: grains, starchy foods, baked goods e.g. rice, sorghum, bread, noodles, masa, porridge, injera
definitions.pana: ijo li pana e ijo ante la ijo ante li tawa tan ijo ni; open la ijo li jo e ijo ante. pini la ijo ante li weka tan ijo ni
definitions.penpo: kon pi nimi ni li sama kulupu nimi "toki pona taso"
definitions.pi: (particle) [group the following words into one modifier for the previous word]
definitions.pika: ilo li kepeken wawa ni. telo li kama tan sewi la wawa ni li kama li kalama suli a li suno suli a.
definitions.pilin: experience e.g. emotion, feeling, touch; heart (physical or emotional)
definitions.pimeja: kule anu suno li weka la ijo li kama pimeja.
definitions.pini: mi pini e ilo la ilo li kama lape. mi pini e pali la mi kama pali ala. nasin li pini la mi ken ala awen tawa lon ona.
definitions.pipi: pipi li lili li pilin. ken suli la noka mute li lon sijelo ona. ken la ona li ken tawa lon kon kepeken lipu lili. ken suli la insa ona li ko. kiwen li lon ona la kiwen ni li selo ona.
definitions.poka: ijo li lon ala sewi lon ala anpa lon ala sinpin lon ala monsi la ona li lon poka. ijo li weka ala la ona li poka kin.
definitions.poki: ijo li jo li awen e ijo ante la ona li poki; ijo ante ni li lon poki.
definitions.pona: positive quality, e.g. good, pleasant, helpful, friendly, useful, peaceful
definitions.powe: ijo li lon ala la, ijo li powe.
definitions.pu: lipu li lon li tan jan Sonja. ni li lipu nanpa wan tan jan Sonja. sina luka anu lukin anu kepeken lipu ni la sina pu.
definitions.puwa: ijo puwa li wile awen e nasin ona. sina lili e ijo puwa la ona li kama suli sin.
definitions.sama: same, similar, alike; (adjective) peer, fellow, each other; (preposition) similar to, same as
definitions.seli: lete ala. ijo li seli la insa ona li kama tawa mute li kama ante mute. ante ni li ken pakala e ijo seli.
definitions.selo: selo li sama len li awen e ijo insa.
definitions.seme: (particle) [indicate a question by marking missing info in a sentence]; what, which, who
definitions.sewi: ijo li lon ala anpa la ona li lon sewi. sewi li nasin e ale. jan li ken ala sona e nasin ona.
definitions.sijelo: sijelo ijo li insa ale ijo.
definitions.sike: circle, sphere, spiral, round thing e.g. ball, wheel; repeating thing e.g. cycle, orbit, loop
definitions.sin: new, fresh, update; repeat, do again
definitions.sina: ijo li toki tawa ijo ante la, ijo toki li nimi "sina" e ijo nanpa tu.
definitions.sinpin: vertical surface e.g. wall, board; front of something e.g. face
definitions.sitelen: sitelen li nasin pi sona awen. jan li sitelen e ijo la jan ante li ken lukin anu kute anu pilin e sitelen ni li ken kama sona e ijo pi jan nanpa wan
definitions.soko: kasi. ona li moku e kasi moli. ona li wan e kasi ante poka li ken e toki ona.
definitions.sona: knowledge, information, data; know, be skilled in, be wise about; (preverb) know how to
definitions.soto: nimi "teje" en nimi "soto" li jo e kon sama nimi ni: nimi "sinpin" en nimi "monsi." linja nimi la, soto li lon poka open.
definitions.soweli: soweli li pilin. ken suli la selo ona li linja li sama ko tawa pilin. ken suli la ona li suli tawa luka jan. ken suli la noka tu tu li lon sijelo ona. selo ona li seli insa tawa pilin jan.
definitions.su: kulupu lipu li lon li tan jan Sonja. lipu nanpa wan pi kulupu ni li lipu nanpa tu wan pi jan Sonja. sina luka anu lukin anu kepeken a e lipu pi kulupu ni la sina su
definitions.suli: ijo li suli la sewi ona li sewi a. ijo li suli la mi wile a sona e ona.
definitions.suno: suno li lon ala la mi ken ala lukin e ijo.
definitions.supa: supa li lipu. ijo li awen lon supa la ona li kama ala anpa.
definitions.sutopatikuna: sutopatikuna li soweli telo pi ma Oselija. ona li mama e soweli lili kepeken sike walo. ona li jo e nena musi suli.
definitions.suwi: suwi li jaki ala li utala ala li pona tawa lukin tawa lawa tawa uta.
definitions.taki: lipu ni li lon luka mi. mi ken ala weka e ona! ona li taki. tan ni la, mi taki e lipu ni lon sinpin mi. tenpo ni la, sinpin mi li jo e lipu ni.
definitions.taso: only, exclusively; (particle) [marks a sentence as qualifying or contradictory], but, however
definitions.tawa: ijo li tawa la ona li kama lon ma ante.
definitions.te: "te" li nimi lili li pana e sona ni: jan li kama toki e toki pi ijo ante.
definitions.teje: nimi "teje" en nimi "soto" li jo e kon sama nimi ni: nimi "sinpin" en nimi "monsi." linja nimi la, teje li lon poka pini.
definitions.telo: liquids e.g. water, gasoline, soda, lava, soup, oil, ink
definitions.tenpo: time, event, situation, moment, period, duration
definitions.to: "to" li nimi lili li pana e sona ni: jan li pini toki e toki pi ijo ante.
definitions.toki: ijo li pana e sona li esun e sona la ona li toki. toki li ken lon insa lawa li ken lon kalama li ken lon sitelen li ken lon nasin ante.
definitions.tomo: ijo li ken lon insa tomo. tomo li awen e ona.
definitions.unu: loje en laso la, "unu" li lon insa.
definitions.usawi: usawi li nasin pi jan sewi lili, anu usawi li ijo pi sona jan ala.
definitions.utala: fight, compete, battle; competition, challenge; struggle, strive
definitions.wa: nimi "wa" li toki mu li toki e pilin pi wawa suli.
definitions.walo: light-colored, white, pale, light gray, cream
definitions.wan: (number) one; singular; combine, join, mix, fuse
definitions.waso: waso mute li ken tawa lon sewi kepeken noka lipu ona li awen sewi e sijelo lon kon. uta ona li kiwen. linja ona li jo e linja lili mute lon selo ona a
definitions.wasoweli: lili la ijo li sama waso li sama soweli. ni la ijo li wasoweli
definitions.wawa: power, energy, strength; confident, intense, forceful; amazing, impressive
definitions.wile: mi wile e ijo la ijo o lon mi.
definitions.wuwojiti: sina kepeken mu "wu" anu mu "wo" anu mu "ji" anu mu "ti" la sina wuwojiti.
definitions.yupekosi: mi yupekosi la, mi ante e pali musi mi sama jan Jo Luka. tan ante ni la, mi pakala li pona ala e pali mi.

awen.definition: keep, care for, hold (in a particular state)

e.language: nimi ni li kama ala tan toki ante

kama.definition: event, arrive, happen, become, bring about, summon

kamalawala.definition: 'arrival of no government', the beginning of anarchy

kiki.language: nimi ni li kama ala tan toki ante

kokosila.definition: sina toki tawa jan pi toki Epelanto lon toki Epelanto ala la sina krokodilas

konwe.definition: John Conway, creator of The Game of Life

ku.language: nimi ni li kama ala tan toki ante

mulapisu.language: nimi ni li kama ala tan toki ante

omekapo.definition: 'eat a good fish', wishing somebody well

owe.definition: jan Sa Owe li sitelen e lipu "1984"

pu.definition: unworked wood, sincere, honest, inherent quality, simple

sina.definition: ijo li toki tawa ijo ante la, ijo toki li nimi "sina" e ijo nanpa tu.

su.language: nimi ni li kama ala tan toki ante

taki.definition: the sound of two magnets hitting each other (onomatopoeia)

unu.definition: loje en laso la, "unu" li lon insa.

yupekosi.language: nimi ni li kama ala tan toki ante

sp_etymology.a: exclamation radical + Latin lowercase letter A; radical from exclamation point (!), without the full stop at the bottom. compare o
sp_etymology.akesi: animal radical; pictogram of a lizard. radical represents eyes
sp_etymology.ala: X mark, a crosslinguistic symbol for negation
sp_etymology.alasa: pictogram of a bow and an arrow
sp_etymology.anpa: location radical + "container"; the latter perhaps from a truncated square for a general object (compare sinpin) or a container (compare poki). for the radical, see also how dots are used in blissymbols; compare blissymbol "below"
sp_etymology.ante: perhaps alteration from sama, or a combination of sama and ala. perhaps an ideogram representing a diversion of two lines
sp_etymology.awen: motion radical; legs facing against each other, implying standing
sp_etymology.en: from plus sign (+); compare blissymbol âandâ.
sp_etymology.esun: not from a currency symbol (sonja confirmed; said âi think that one is from Mikmaqâ but couldn't find a mikmaq symbol similar to it).
sp_etymology.ijo: a circle, for a general object
sp_etymology.ike: pictogram of a frowning mouth. compare pona
sp_etymology.ilo: perhaps a pictogram of a hammer
sp_etymology.insa: location radical + âcontainerâ; compare blissymbol âinâ
sp_etymology.jan: head radical; pictogram of a person showing the shoulders
sp_etymology.jo: perhaps a pictogram of a person pointing at themself or holding something
sp_etymology.kama: motion radical; legs facing to the left. compare tawa and blissymbol âwalkâ
sp_etymology.ken: ken la ona li tan sitelen "K" tan sitelen Lasina
sp_etymology.kijetesantakalu: a drawing of a raccoon with a tail
sp_etymology.kili: pictogram of a fruit, perhaps an apple
sp_etymology.kiwen: pictogram of a rock or a gem
sp_etymology.kon: ideogram; wavy lines to indicate the fluidity of gas. compare telo
sp_etymology.konwe: pictogram of a glider in Conway's Game of Life, a machine which moves across the game board.
sp_etymology.ku: pictogram of the front cover of âToki Pona Dictionaryâ, depicting a jacket with a toki pona patch.
sp_etymology.kule: color radical; perhaps the horizontal line indicates the sense of âthe concept itselfâ. or perhaps a pictogram of light passing through a prism (color radical)
sp_etymology.kulupu: pictogram of a group consisting of three members represented by circles
sp_etymology.kute: pictogram of an ear. compare blissymbol âearâ
sp_etymology.la: perhaps related to blissymbol âlaterâ and âagoâ, or perhaps a parenthesis
sp_etymology.lawa: head radical; perhaps the horizontal line for the same reason as in kule. alternatively perhaps a pictogram of a person wearing a cap
sp_etymology.len: perhaps a pictogram of a piece of fabric
sp_etymology.lili: ideogram showing smaller size compared to suli
sp_etymology.lipu: pictogram of a sheet of paper. compare blissymbol âpaperâ
sp_etymology.lon: location radical above a line. compare blissymbol âoverâ
sp_etymology.lukin: pictogram of an eye. compare blissymbol âeyeâ
sp_etymology.lupa: pictogram of a concave surface. compare nena
sp_etymology.ma: perhaps from modern astronomical symbol âearthâ (â)
sp_etymology.mama: head radical; perhaps the smaller circle representing the child
sp_etymology.mani: a pictogram of a large domestic animal, such as a cow (sonja confirmed)
sp_etymology.mi: perhaps a hand pointing towards the speaker. compare sina and ona
sp_etymology.mije: head radical with perhaps wide shoulders. compare jan
sp_etymology.moli: head radical; a dead person, represented by the crossed eyes
sp_etymology.monsi: location radical + rotate âcontainerâ. compare sinpin
sp_etymology.monsuta: visual representation of shaking as seen in cartoons
sp_etymology.mun: pictogram of a crescent moon. compare blissymbol âmoonâ
sp_etymology.musi: perhaps a pictogram of a smile with rosy cheeks or a lyre
sp_etymology.mute: ideogram consisting of three tally marks. compare wan and tu
sp_etymology.n: exclamation radical with the lowercase letter ânâ
sp_etymology.nanpa: tan sitelen "#" nanpa. o lukin e sitelen Pisinpo pi nimi "number" kin.
sp_etymology.nasa: perhaps spiral representing âdizzinessâ, as can be commonly seen in Japanese manga and anime
sp_etymology.nasin: ideogram consisting of an arrow along a vertical line
sp_etymology.nena: pictogram of a convex surface. compare lupa
sp_etymology.nimi: perhaps a pictogram of a nametag or sitelen pona cartouche
sp_etymology.noka: pictogram of a foot with an ankle
sp_etymology.o: exclamation radical + Latin lowercase letter O. compare a
sp_etymology.olin: two heart symbols (â¡), perhaps to distinguish from pilin. [alternate] pilin with emitters
sp_etymology.ona: perhaps a hand pointing sideways. compare mi and sina
sp_etymology.open: perhaps a pictogram of an opened container
sp_etymology.pan: perhaps a pictogram of a grain crop
sp_etymology.pilin: from heart symbol (â¡). compare blissymbol âfeelingâ
sp_etymology.pimeja: color radical; perhaps the cross representing the absence of light
sp_etymology.pipi: animal radical; pictogram of a bug
sp_etymology.pona: pictogram of a smiling mouth. compare ike
sp_etymology.pu: pictogram of the cover of the book âToki Pona: The Language of Goodâ. alternatively a semantic compound glyph of lipu and toki pona
sp_etymology.sama: from equal sign (=). compare blissymbol âsameâ
sp_etymology.seli: perhaps a pictogram of a lit campfire or a simplified pictogram of a fire
sp_etymology.seme: from question mark (?). compare blissymbol âwhatâ
sp_etymology.sewi: tan toki Alapi Ù¡ÙÙÙÙÙâ âallahâ (sewi Ala)
sp_etymology.sijelo: perhaps a pictogram of a torso
sp_etymology.sike: two circles, perhaps to distinguish from ijo. alternatively outline of a thick empty circle
sp_etymology.sina: perhaps a hand pointing towards the listener. compare mi and ona
sp_etymology.sinpin: location radical + rotate âcontainerâ. compare monsi
sp_etymology.sitelen: perhaps a representation of symbols on a piece of paper (lipu)
sp_etymology.soweli: animal radical; pictogram of a mammal
sp_etymology.su: pictogram of the front cover of The Wizard of Oz illustrated story book, depicting the yellow brick road from the story
sp_etymology.suli: ideogram showing bigger size compared to lili
sp_etymology.supa: pictogram of a table. compare blissymbol âtableâ
sp_etymology.suwi: perhaps a pictogram of a smiling face
sp_etymology.tan: a leaping arrow pointing from right to left, implying derivation or cause
sp_etymology.tawa: motion radical; legs facing to the right. compare kama and blissymbol âwalkâ
sp_etymology.telo: pictogram of wave. compare blissymbol âwaterâ
sp_etymology.tenpo: pictogram of a clock. compare blissymbol âtimeâ
sp_etymology.toki: emitters + ijo or a general circle
sp_etymology.tomo: pictogram of a house. compare blissymbol âhouseâ
sp_etymology.tu: two tally marks. compare mute and wan
sp_etymology.unpa: perhaps a derivation of heart symbol (especially visible from the original drawing of the character), or a knot pattern implying intercourse, or perhaps a pictogram of a genitalia
sp_etymology.walo: color radical; perhaps the reverse of pimeja, the color radical cutting of the cross instead of vice versa
sp_etymology.wan: one tally mark or Indo-Arabic numeral 1, perhaps to make it more distinct
sp_etymology.waso: animal radical; pictogram of a bird
sp_etymology.wawa: perhaps a pictogram of a person with raised arms, to signify strength
sp_etymology.weka: âpoof linesâ; indicating the movement of something disappearing
sp_etymology.wile: ken la ona li tan sitelen "W" tan sitelen Lasina
